title: Far West Community Associates: Study Series
hero_caption: Edward Kemeys. Lion (One of a Pair, South Pedestal), 1893. ® The Art Institute of Chicago.
short_description: Far West offers five events with a variety of presentations enhancing the themes of Chicago Artists & Beyond and Exploring the world through Art.
list_description: Far West offers five events with a variety of presentations enhancing the themes of Chicago Artists & Beyond and Exploring the world through Art.
description:
Join Far West Community Associates as we gather in Cantigny Park’s lovely Visitor’s Center Theater in Winfield to hear fall presentations on Chicago artists of the past and the present. The topics range from The Hairy Who and Ivan Albright to several contemporary artists. Spring topics will encompass art in far-away places and throughout history from Russia to the classics.

Location: Cantigny Park at 1 S 151 Winfield Road, Wheaton, IL 60189

Program Capacity: 120

Registration period: Thursday, September 13, 2018 – Monday, October 8, 2018

Study Series Schedule:

Chicago Artists & Beyond:

Thursday, October 11
Chicago Connections: Catlett and White by Marti Seaton
Chicago Artists: from 1960’s On by Alice Douglas

Thursday, November 8
Three Albright Artists by Sue Krause
Tour of Robert R. McCormick House by Cheryl Groth and Lorraine Gawlik

Exploring the World Through Art:

Thursday, February 14
Russian Architecture by Jasmeet Sekhon
he Art of Tapestry Weaving by Laura Davis

Thursday, March 14
The Era of Georgia O’Keeffe by Judy Hunnicut
Beauty in Everyday Life by Anne Gorham

Thursday, April 11
Stories from Caesar to Bandits, Beauties and Mermaids by Roger Tilbrook
Allan Houser: The Man and his Art by Sue Ciezki

Schedule of the Day:

9:00 Doors Open

9:30-11:30 Program

Lunch Menu: Coffee and tea with breakfast pastries and bread

To reach the event planner, please contact Lorraine Gawlik at (630) 469-7330 or email lmgawlik01@att.net. To reach the assistant event planner, please contact Cheryl Groth at (630) 363-0947 or email dwightgroth@sbcglobal.net.

This Community Associates event is exclusively for current Community Associates members. Membership will be verified at the door, and refunds cannot be issued for those without a valid membership. For Community Associates events that allow guests, nonmember guests must be registered by a Community Associates member.

If you are interested in becoming a member of Community Associates, please visit artic.edu/joinnow to join both the Art Institute of Chicago and the Community Associates group of your choice.
location: Visitors Center Theater of Cantigny Park at 1S151 Winfield Road, Wheaton, IL 60189
buy_button_caption: $35 per person for a series of 5 events, open to Community Associates members
